comments.body: I had the impression that files named `run_test.{sh,py}` would be automatically discovered and run by `conda-build`. Is that necessary because you have both instead of one? If so I consider this a conda-build bug.

Yes, they will.

The problem is the linter doesn't realize those tests files are there and will complain about the `test` section being blank or missing. So, I have been adding them explicitly.

I suppose we could fix the linter to stop this behavior. OTOH, this does make the testing very explicit. I am kind of ok with doing it like this going forward. What are your thoughts?

I like the idea of explicit tests, but I think we should fix the linter too since the implicit test is a conda-build feature. (Maybe the correct way to fix the linter is ensure the recipe has test section and/or the test files.)

Maybe we can just have the linter issue warnings if the `test` section is blank, but the `run_test.*` files are present. Don't know if that would be too noisy. Let me open an issue and we can discuss this there.
See this issue ( https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/issues/81 ) for the linter problem.
